answers.answer: Yes that could have an impact on the results just make sure for your 3 hour you leave yourself a note to not eat before the appt.
Ok thank you and i will i dont want no mistakes.
I hate the three hour test it always makes me feel like poo! Just drink a lot of water and it helps to walk around in between them taking the samples. Good luck
Have protein the night before that's something that I learned later after I failed my 3hr. Have protein at dinner and protein for your bed time snack

Do not change what you regularly do! All that will do is skew results and then you will go back to bad habits! GD ***** but I would think you would want to get accurate results, not results that could potentially lead you to having GD un-diagnosed and lead to issues for not only you but also the baby! I got diagnosed and I hate it but I am healthier for my baby and myself! It is hard to change diet and exercise but GD is not the end of everything!

Drinking lots of cold water and walking will lower your sugars because both things boost your metabolism...but if you ever (or often are not very active after drinking sugary drinks/eating a meal) drink a soda and watch a regular length movie without going for a long walk or doing some exercise it will not be very accurate... Your decision, but honestly I would really talk to your dr and not change what you do regularly! Trying to beat/cheat the test isn't a good idea...beat the test because you are healthy and really don't have GD!

question: Hi, im 28 weeks a 4 days i went to dr yest. And i got my results from my diabetes test and now i gotta go back for a 3 hour test. I just wanna know what i should expect? I forgot that i had that test yest and i ate mcds before my appt is there a possibility that thats the reason it was high? Im super nervous and scared. All information is greatly appreciated.
title: gestational diabetes
